simmasto0

Class C_RasterGraphManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • simmasto0.C_RasterManager
      • simmasto0.C_RasterGraphManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_sim_constants, I_ground_manager

    public class C_RasterGraphManager
extends C_RasterManager
    Classe encapsulant les informations sur le graphe Dans cette classe nous allons constuire principalement le graphe et sa matrice d'adjacence (edgesList) en utiliasant les classes C_UnweightedGraph et C_TrackCell
    Author:
    Mboup 05/08/2012
    See Also:
    C_UnweightedGraph, C_SoilCellGraphed

      • buildGraphsFromLandPlots

        public void buildGraphsFromLandPlots(java.util.TreeSet<C_LandPlot> aLandPlotList,
                            java.lang.String... graphTypeParam)
        This method build new graphs and update the olds for a group of landPlot in the same groundTpe.
        This method can also build a graph (or a portion of graph) contained in another landPlot with optional parameter;
        eg build a graph corresponding to the portion of road located on the Groundnut Basin.
        Parameters:
        aLandPlotList -
        graphTypeParam - optional

      • identifyTypeLandPlots

        public java.util.TreeSet<C_LandPlot> identifyTypeLandPlots(java.lang.String groundType,
                                                  repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object>... context)
        This method scan all the soilCellMatrix and detect all landPlots with the groundType in param;
        taking into account that a soilCell may belong simultaneously to several landPlots with differents groundTypes.
        This method doesn't update old landPlots but it build new.
        When we need to update old landPlots with the news, we do that with the C_InspectorCentenal.updateFullLandPlotList() method and we call this method without context parameter
        Parameters:
        groundType -
        context - optional
        Returns:
        a list of landPlot
        See Also:
        C_InspectorTransportation.updateFullLandPlotList(java.util.Set<thing.ground.C_LandPlot>, java.lang.String, repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object>)
